results.byline: By Chris Cameron, Aishvarya Kavi, Eliza Fawcett, Ava Sasani and Edgar Sandoval
results.title: ‘We Were a Family’: Victims in Walmart Shooting Had Bonded on Overnight Shift
results.abstract: Colleagues and relatives mourned the six people killed in a shooting at a Walmart store in Virginia.

media.caption: A candlelight vigil for victims of the shooting was held at St. Thomas Episcopal Church in Chesapeake on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;#MeToo Movement;Sex Crimes;Decisions and Verdicts;Wu, Kris (1990- );Du Meizhu;China;Canada
results.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Claire Fu
results.title: Chinese Court Sentences Canadian Singer to Prison for Rape
results.abstract: Before his arrest over #MeToo allegations, Kris Wu was one of China’s most popular entertainers, with legions of fans and brand deals.

media.caption: The pop singer Kris Wu in Toronto, in 2018. He has become arguably the most prominent figure in China to face punishment over #MeToo allegations.
media.copyright: Frank Gunn/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;United States Politics and Government;Kemp, Brian P;Walker, Herschel;Warnock, Raphael G;Atlanta (Ga);Cobb County (Ga);Fulton County (Ga)
results.title: In Georgia Runoff, a Campaign Cliché Rules: It All Comes Down to Turnout
results.abstract: With control of the Senate no longer at stake, the race between Herschel Walker and Raphael Warnock is drawing less attention. Both sides are pulling out all the stops to drive voters to the polls.

media.caption: A polling center in Kennesaw, Ga., on Election Day earlier this month.
media.copyright: Gabriela Bhaskar for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Governors (US);Fast Food Industry;Basketball;Brown, John Y Jr;George, Phyllis;Democratic Party;Kentucky Fried Chicken;Los Angeles Clippers;Kentucky
results.title: John Y. Brown Jr., KFC Mogul and Kentucky Governor, Dies at 88
results.abstract: Though his political career was brief, after storming to victory with a former Miss America by his side, he made millions by buying the fried chicken chain.

media.caption: Mr. Brown in 1981 at a formal event in New York City with his wife at the time, Phyllis George, the CBS sportscaster and former Miss America.

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump’s Latest Dinner Guest: Nick Fuentes, White Supremacist
results.abstract: The former president’s table for four at Mar-a-Lago on Tuesday also included Kanye West, whose antisemitic statements have made him an entertainment-industry outcast.

media.caption: Nick Fuentes during a rally at the Michigan State Capitol in Lansing in 2020.
media.copyright: Nicole Hester/Ann Arbor News, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Chesapeake, Va, Walmart Shooting (Nov, 2022);Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Bing, Andre (1991-2022);Walmart Stores Inc;Chesapeake (Va)
results.title: Walmart Gunman Bought Pistol Hours Before Killing and Left a ‘Death Note’
results.abstract: A message found by the police on the killer’s phone asked God to forgive him for targeting co-workers, whose deaths were the latest in a string of mass shooting fatalities.

media.caption: A memorial outside the Walmart in Chesapeake, Va., where a gunman fatally shot six people on Tuesday night.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Palestinians;Salah, Raed (1958- );Tiran Fero;Palestinian Authority;Palestinian Islamic Jihad;Israel;West Bank
results.title: An Israeli Schoolboy Died in the West Bank. To Find His Body, Foes Joined Forces.
results.abstract: After Palestinian gunmen refused to hand over a dead Israeli teenager on Tuesday, officials on both sides of the conflict worked together to recover his abducted body.

media.caption: Members of the Israeli Druse community carrying the coffin of Tiran Fero, a schoolboy whose body had been seized by Palestinian militants, during his funeral in Israel, on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Civil Rights and Liberties;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Bainimarama, Frank;Fiji
results.title: He Pointed Out a Judge’s Goof. Now, He Faces Jail Time in Fiji.
results.abstract: A lawyer who made light of a legal document’s error was convicted of contempt of court, in a sign of the island nation’s eroding civil liberties.

media.caption: A crossing in Suva, Fiji’s capital, last year. Democracy is fragile in Fiji, which has experienced four coups d’état since 1987.

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;Embargoes and Sanctions;Nuclear Weapons;Foreign Aid;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Iran;Russia
results.title: United States Enters a New Era of Direct Confrontation With Iran
results.abstract: The Biden administration has imposed new sanctions on Tehran and expressed support for protesters, as the Iranian government aids Russia in the Ukraine war and continues nuclear enrichment.

media.caption: A protest in Tehran in September. The antigovernment demonstrations were kindled by the arrest and death of Mahsa Amini.

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Love (Emotion);Dating and Relationships
results.title: In Praise of the 10-Percent Wrong Relationship
results.abstract: We fear imperfection in our love lives. What if we embrace it instead?

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Television;Christians and Christianity;Religion and Belief;Crowdfunding (Internet);Jesus Christ
results.title: Jesus Christ, Streaming Star
results.abstract: “The Chosen,” a TV series about the life of Jesus, pulls off a crowd-funded miracle: a hit with a Christian fan base that is breaking into the mainstream.

media.caption: Actors playing Jesus’ apostles handed out bread and fish to extras in Texas, re-enacting a miracle described in the Bible.
media.copyright: Brandon Thibodeaux for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Sheriffs;Mental Health and Disorders;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Glass, Christian (d 2022);Colorado;Denver (Colo);Rocky Mountains
results.title: Sheriff’s Deputies Are Indicted in Fatal Shooting of Man Who Called 911
results.abstract: The Sheriff’s Office in Clear Creek County, Colo., said it fired the deputies, Andrew Buen and Kyle Gould, after they were charged in connection with the shooting of Christian Glass, 22, in June.

media.caption: Police body camera footage shows Christian Glass behind the wheel of his Honda Pilot after it became stuck on an embankment on a mountain road near Silver Plume, Colo., on the night of June 10.

results.adx_keywords: World Cup 2022 (Soccer);International Relations;Fans (Persons);Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming
results.title: Frustrations Simmer as Saudis Are Blocked From Watching the World Cup
results.abstract: A curious dispute between a Qatari broadcaster and Saudi media regulators has left millions of Saudis with no way to watch the matches.

media.caption: Fans in Dubai watched the match between Argentina and Saudi Arabia on Tuesday.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Mass Shootings;Deaths (Fatalities);Chesapeake, Va, Walmart Shooting (Nov, 2022);Walmart Stores Inc;Chesapeake (Va)
results.title: Here’s What We Know About the Walmart Shooting in Virginia
results.abstract: A gunman, who was an employee at the store in Chesapeake, killed six people and was later found dead, apparently of a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the police said.

media.caption: Law enforcement officers on the scene the day after a mass shooting at a Walmart in Chesapeake, Va.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Children and Childhood;Welfare (US);Poverty;Research;Child Tax Credits and Stipends;Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.title: The Expanded Child Tax Credit Is Gone. The Battle Over It Remains.
results.abstract: A pandemic-era program that sent monthly checks of up to $300 per child to most families drove down poverty rates. Amid new research about its merits, some Democrats are vowing to bring it back.

media.caption: Tax credit payments of $750 a month raised cash income by nearly 50 percent for Thomas Horton and his wife, Pamela Mudge, lifting them above the poverty line and providing them breaks from the family’s frugal norms.
media.copyright: Nate Smallwood for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colorado Springs Shooting (Nov, 2022);Veterans;Content Type: Personal Profile;Fierro, Richard M;Colorado Springs (Colo)
results.title: Army Veteran Went Into ‘Combat Mode’ to Disarm the Club Q Gunman
results.abstract: Richard M. Fierro, who served for 15 years in the military, was at the nightclub in Colorado Springs with his family when the gunman opened fire. “I just knew I had to take him down,” he said.

results.adx_keywords: K-Pop;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Content Type: Personal Profile;Psy (Rapper);Gangnam District (Seoul, South Korea);South Korea
results.byline: By Jin Yu Young and Victoria Kim
results.title: ‘Gangnam Style’ Brought K-Pop to the World, but Haunted Its Creator
results.abstract: In 2012, the song took over the internet, and it helped pave the way for the global success of Korean pop. But Psy, the artist behind it, spent years trying and failing to replicate the phenomenon.

media.caption: Psy during an interview on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his hit “Gangnam Style,” at his office in Seoul (specifically, in the Gangnam area).
media.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Language and Languages;Gaelic Language;Education (K-12);United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization;Isle of Man
results.title: An Ancient Language, Once on the Brink, Is a British Isle’s Talk of the Town
results.abstract: After being nearly silenced, Manx is experiencing a revival on the Isle of Man, thanks in part to an elementary school and some impassioned parents.
org_facet: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Airport Security;Transportation Security Administration;Salt Lake City (Utah);Utah
results.title: Utah Man Charged With Assault After Brandishing Razor on Flight, U.S. Says
results.abstract: The man, Merrill Darrell Fackrell, 41, of Syracuse, Utah, was on a JetBlue flight from New York to Salt Lake City when he held the blade near a passenger’s throat, federal prosecutors said.

media.caption: A Utah man is facing federal charges alleging that he threatened a fellow passenger on a flight to Salt Lake City from New York on Monday.

results.title: Trudeau Defends Use of Emergencies Act During Trucker Protest
results.abstract: He strongly defended the decision at a public inquiry into the government’s use of an emergency law to shut down the blockade.

media.caption: Police officers clearing demonstrators from near the Canadian capital in Ottawa in February.
media.copyright: Ian Willms for The New York Times
